intro: Trigonia laevis var. microcarpa, commonly known as the smooth trigonia, is a species of flowering plant native to southern Africa. It belongs to the Acanthaceae family and is characterized by its smooth, glabrous leaves and clusters of small, tubular flowers. The plant typically grows in moist, shaded environments such as forest understories or along stream banks. Its flowers are usually pink to purple in color and attract various pollinators, including bees and butterflies. The fruit is a small, dry capsule that releases tiny seeds when mature.
